0.name: Wooden cart
0.tooltip: Increases your inventory capacity by 5

1.name: Wooden hut
1.tooltip: Lowers health decay by 50%, but does not prevent it from going up again

2.name: Campfire
2.tooltip: Allows you to cook raw food such as fish

3.name: Stone cart
3.tooltip: Increases your inventory capacity by 5

4.name: Stone hut
4.tooltip: Lowers health decay by 50%, but does not prevent it from going up again

5.name: Bridge
5.tooltip: A bridge is needed to cross the lake and explore what's on the other side

6.name: Raft
6.tooltip: A raft is required to sail to the nearby island

7.name: Copper club
7.tooltip: Increases the multiplier of your combat skill by 25%

8.name: Stone oven
8.tooltip: Increases the multiplier of your cooking skill by 25%

9.name: Boots
9.tooltip: Increases the multiplier of your agility skill by 25%

10.name: Raft sail
10.tooltip: Increases the multiplier of your sailing skill by 25%

11.name: Tree house
11.tooltip: Useful to search from a higher vantage point

12.name: Stone house
12.tooltip: Lowers health decay by 50%, but does not prevent it from going up again

13.name: Cocowood raft
13.tooltip: Increases the multiplier of your sailing skill by 25%

14.name: Cocowood hut
14.tooltip: Lowers health decay by 50%, but does not prevent it from going up again

15.name: Iron stick
15.tooltip: Increases the multiplier of your combat skill by 25%

16.name: Cocowood soles
16.tooltip: Increases the multiplier of your agility skill by 25%

17.name: Reinforced belt
17.tooltip: Triples your maximum health

18.name: Cocowood cart
18.tooltip: Increases your inventory capacity by 5

19.name: Gemstone ring
19.tooltip: Makes you look fancy, causing others to respect you more! Increases the multiplier of your social skill by 25%

20.name: Small shrine
20.tooltip: Respectful of those that have come before you. Doubles your maximum health gain after life

21.name: Gem pendant
21.tooltip: Channels the ancient power of these gems into your skills! Increases the multiplier of all your skills by 10%

22.name: Clay hut
22.tooltip: Lowers health decay by 50%, but does not prevent it from going up again

23.name: Lobster pot
23.tooltip: A wooden cage to catch lobsters with. Allows you to catch lobsters

24.name: Boat
24.tooltip: Used to sail bigger waters than your raft would be able to. Can be expanded after completion, if not in a hurry

25.name: Cabin
25.tooltip: Lowers health decay by 50%, but does not prevent it from going up again

26.name: Gathering gloves
26.tooltip: Prevents scratches on your hands while gathering. Increases the multiplier of your farming skill by 25%

27.name: Fishing rod
27.tooltip: Useful when catching creatures in the water. Increases the multiplier of your fishing skill by 25%

28.name: Wooden bow
28.tooltip: Handy when hunting creatures from a distance. Increases the multiplier of your hunting skill by 25%

29.name: Simple axe
29.tooltip: One might wonder how you've managed to cut down so many trees without a tool like this. Increases the multiplier of your woodcutting skill by 25%

30.name: Simple hammer
30.tooltip: Hitting things with this causes constructions to complete quicker. Increases the multiplier of your construction skill by 25%

31.name: Copper shovel
31.tooltip: Makes digging a little easier than it is with your hands. Increases the multiplier of your digging skill by 25%

32.name: Pan of soup
32.tooltip: Provides the tribe (as well as you) with soup! It's not entirely clear what sort of soup this is, it's a local recipe

33.name: Liana rope
33.tooltip: Weave liana vines into a sturdy rope. Useful to swing over things

34.name: Fortify cart
34.tooltip:
Expands the capacity of your wooden cart by 5
Requires a wooden cart to expand

35.name: Strengthen cart
35.tooltip:
Expands the capacity of your stone cart by 5
Requires a stone cart to expand

36.name: Toughen cart
36.tooltip:
Expands the capacity of your cocowood cart by 5
Requires a cocowood cart to expand

37.name: Fortify barricade
37.tooltip: Use the wood from old ships to reinforce their barricades. Has no useful purpose to you, but they're not giving you a choice in the matter

38.name: Limestone hut
38.tooltip: Lowers health decay by 50%, but does not prevent it from going up again

39.name: Repair minecart
39.tooltip: Limestone is a tricky material to repair wheels with, but it should do the trick to travel over these rails

40.name: Magma hut
40.tooltip: Lowers health decay by 50%, but does not prevent it from going up again

41.name: Magma shrine
41.tooltip: For people to pay respect to nature's rawest power. Doubles your maximum health gain after life

42.name: Upgrade shrine
42.tooltip: Expand the shrine for another 50% maximum health gain after life

43.name: Ceremonial fire
43.tooltip: Place coal under the ceremonial fire, so it can be ignited

44.name: Classic toolkit
44.tooltip:
Contains a wooden bow and a copper shovel, which increase the skill multipliers of digging and hunting by 25%. These are the same tools as were available in the chapter 5 city, and do not stack.
Only available if you haven't already obtained both items earlier

45.name: Slingshot
45.tooltip: Some kids are selling a homemade slingshot. It looks pretty decent and is probably effective at shooting small objects to some height. You can't really think of a use for it at the moment though. Perhaps you'll find a use for it at a later time?

46.name: Pearl necklace
46.tooltip:
A rare collection of pearls beautifully woven into a necklace. If it wasn't for the incredibly high price, you wouldn't believe anyone would sell such a treasure
Increases the multiplier of all your skills by 10%

47.name: Steel belt
47.tooltip: Quadruples your maximum health, but replaces your iron belt if you have one

48.name: Steel hut
48.tooltip: Hardly comfortable, but very robust. Lowers health decay by 50%, but does not prevent it from going up again

49.name: Steel fork
49.tooltip:
Useful for consuming food. The blueprint says it should be closer to 5 steel, but getting the tines right proves tricky without further knowledge. Luckily nobody seems to pay enough attention to judge you
Increases the health value of all your food by 10% for the rest of this generation, without any penalty

50.name: Catapult
50.tooltip: You should be able to launch debris with such a tool! Although it'll need to be loaded after completion

51.name: Load catapult
51.tooltip: Load your catapult with some debris for maximum fire power! But you'll need to reload it again after firing your catapult

52.name: Titanstone hut
52.tooltip:
Are you sure you have the time to build this while the titan is firing arrows at you?
Lowers health decay by 50%, but does not prevent it from going up again
